author: Angelo Grant

text: It's smaller, more niche titles like this, that 90% of people wouldn't enjoy but are beloved beyond belief by the 10% that are true successes. CoD or Battlefield may sell millions, but I firmly do believe they bring less joy to the people that play them than weird little titles like Deadly Premonition, Killer7 or the Mother series.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: As someone that enjoys niche titles like Eternal Darkness or Lufia, I don't think it's fair to say they're more fun or bring more joy than the more popular games. Just because it's a different kind of joy, doesn't mean it's lesser.
author: pianoguy222

text: @pianoguy222 I don't know, I've always found that niche titles that fit the things I like perfectly are the most enjoyable experiences, simply because they're hitting exactly what they need to hit to make ME, in particular, happy. To put it in RPG terms (because I feel the need to for some reason), they're specializing in the spells I have a weakness to. The way popular titles are spread out to appeal a little to everyone I think isn't as condusive to that kind of stuff. I do enjoy Battlefield a lot (CoD maybe a little less), but I don't enjoy it at quite that fundamental level, if I'm making any sense.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: I think that speaks more to your own preferences. Why cannot someone's preferred "niche" be the multiplayer cover-based shooting that CoD or Battlefield offers?

author: BygPhattyPlus

text:
I watched the giantbomb playthrough of this and happy songs don't play during the worst moments. the types of mysterious, scary and shocking music you expect playing during the tense moments.

In a nut shell: the controls are stiff and outdated, but the game makes up for it by being the most ambitious, charming and creative stories even in a game i've seen.

p.s. I love this song, don't you agree Zack?
author: ConvoyGTR

text:

text:
I haven't played this game yet but I've heard some weird things about it. It's an open world humoristic survival horror game, I think. The Destructoid review might be a good place to get an idea of what this game is about (they gave it a 10/10). Supposedly happy songs like this one play during the worst moments and rarely fit the scene.

Also, my thoughts and prayers go to anyone in Japan right now, it's horrible what's happening there right now with the earthquakes and the tsunamis.
author: SupraDarky
